Science tries to find out what "works" (and why).=A0 Science would only rej=
ect something that didn't work.=A0 Science will accept evidence of a theory=
, but will also compare it to competing theories, and try to develop experi=
ments to determine which theory best supports the evidence.

So while creat=
ing a theory that an EVP is from a spirit is perfectly allowed in science, =
so is creating a theory that an EVP is just noise and being misinterpreted =
by the listener as words.=A0 Science would then continue to examine evidenc=
e, and test it against both theories, and give the most credence to the the=
ory that can best predict ongoing results.

I realize the purpose as stated=
 in this group's description, that you are "not really scientific".=A0 And =
when science tries to examine competing theories, sometimes it refers to th=
is as "debunking" one or the other (not all meanings of "debunk" are meant =
to be insulting or negative).=A0 So perhaps your frustration is that you ar=
e trying to occasionally challenge science, yet admitting you are not follo=
wing a scientific methodology.=A0 This would definately lead to friction be=
tween all involved (as another statement in the group description indiciate=
s: "If I detect attempts at debunking, I'll ban
immediately!")

So to remov=
e this frustration, I'd recommend either completely adopting the scientific=
 method here, and with your research, and stating that in the group (which =
would of course encourage testing and debunking), or completely distancing =
yourself from science, from claims about facts and proven methods, and just=
 keep to the part of the group definition that says "I just take the approa=
ch, try different methods, see what works (for you).".=A0 I feel that the w=
ay things are - being half in, half out, of a scientific approach - will ju=
st continue to cause accusations of negativity and ignorance, from one side=
 or the other.

" The method for this communication was *not* based on radio sweep, nor tra=
ditional methods, so it's not based on what I assume many people here are d=
oing. And in fact, it *was* based on the creations of someone outside of th=
e USA, so I'm a little confused as to why all the hostility toward AAEVP fo=
r putting up the money.


Sadly, radio sweep methods don't, and may not for=
 a long time, get the respect of the scientific community that it deserves =
(then again, seems no form of EVP does), but at least this current research=
 is a step in the right direction. I hope, when Windbridge concludes their =
study, that it will support the notion that there is apparent communication=
 formed in ways that cannot be explained by currently known and understood =
laws of nature. THAT alone, in my opinion, would be a big plus for all ITC =
communities, regardless of the method from which that communication was rec=
eived. What's the old saying? "It takes but one white crow to prove all cro=
ws are not black." Any proof, derived from any EVP method, would be greatly=
 welcomed as far as I'm concerned.
